newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Painewebber ups two TV stocks.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Painewebber ups two TV stocks.

text.p: -- PaineWebber analyst Chris Dixon said he upgraded Liberty Media Group and United Video Satellite Group Inc to buy from attractive.
-- Dixon said he made no change in his earnings estimates for either company.
-- He described his upgrade of Liberty in particular as a "table-pouding" buy.
-- The analyst said he expected Liberty stock to trade in the "mid-30s" over the next 12 months, with United Video in the "mid-20s" during the same timeframe.
-- Liberty shares were up 5/8 to 24-1/8 by mid-morning Monday. United Video gained 1-1/2 to 16.
-- "In both cases, the valuations are extremely compelling," he said. United Video's book value is close to $28 per share, he calculated, while Liberty's is around $40 per share.
-- He said that while recognizing that the stocks will trade at some discount to their asset valuations, that still leaves room for Liberty to gain another $10 or so, he said.
-- Liberty is a unit of Tele-Communications Inc.
-- United Video supplies "Prevue" cable TV programming guides and satellite TV services.
